numbered_ace_sentences: 1. If a parent has a higher income and if a person has a relative who went to an elite college then the person has a very high chance of acceptance into this elite college.
2. A legacy applicant has a parent.
3. A non-legacy applicant has a parent.
4. Some legacy applicants have parents who have lower income.
5. Some non-legacy applicants have parents who have a lot higher income.
6. A legacy applicant who has a parent who has lower income has about the same chance of acceptance as a non-legacy applicant who has a parent who has a lot higher income.
7. I wonder what this graph would look like if the graph included colleges from today.
8. I wonder how the graph would compare to the data from 1999 to 2015.
9. I wonder if anything could change the bias toward parents with higher income in legacy status.
10. This topic relates to me and my community.
11. I know some people who apply to college.
12. Some elite colleges are near me.
13. It is surprising that these elite colleges might make biased admission decisions.
14. These biased admission decisions might depend on parent income and legacy status.
15. The headline is: How the college admission system is still rigged.
